# Draft:Vladimir Makarov (Modern Warfare)

Vladimir Makarov is a fictional villain from the Call Of Duty Modern Warfare series. He appears in the following:
Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare
Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2
Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3
Call of Duty: Ghosts
Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare
Call of Duty: Modern Warfare Remastered
Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 Campaign Remastered
Call of Duty: Modern Warfare III
Makarov is the main antagonist of the series. First introduced in Call of Duty's 2009 Modern Warfare story, Makarov is depicted as a violent and an ultranationalist responsible for several large-scale terrorist attacks that drive the narrative of the stories he's apart of. He is commonly regarded as the franchise's most notorious villains, and his character has been featured in both the original and reboot of the "Modern Warfare" Call of Duty series.
Character:
Vladimir Makarov (voiced by Julian Kostov) is first presented as the associate of Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare's main antagonist Imran Zakhaev. After the death of Zakhaev, Makarov takes the reigns of the ultra nationalist terrorist group, emerging as the new leader of the movement. Motivated by his radical and ultra nationalist ideals, he pursues a vigorous and violent agenda, with intent to cause global destabilization and international large scale conflicts.
In the original Modern Warfare trilogy, Vladimir Makarov directly sparks the start of World War three. Being the driving force of the international conflict between Russia and the United States. In the 2019-2023 reboot, Makarov is presented in the same light, a radical ultra nationalistic terrorist with fresh motives and the same violent intent. He continues his terrorist rampage while expanding his ultranationalist network.
Appearances in the franchise:
Modern Warfare Series (2009â€“2011):
Makarov plays a major factor in the first Modern Warfare trilogy, where he orchestrates the airport massacre depicted in MW2's "No Russian" mission. His operations cross numerous continents, pulling international militaries into conflict with one another stemming from his actions. In Modern Warfare 3 (2011), he is presented as the final antagonist, and players tail Makarov around Europe as he attempts to expand the major world war he initiated.
Modern Warfare Reboot (2022-2023):
In the new reboot series, Makarov makes his first reappearance in Modern Warfare II (2022), but takes on the main antagonist role in Modern Warfare III (2023). This version in the reboot retains many of the classic Makarov traits that the franchise created in 2009, however his motives seem more politically driven. He leads a new collation, the Konni Group; a private militia group that aligns with Makarov's extremist agenda. Makarov's Konni Group becomes the focal point in the Modern Warfare III story, as pla<play as Task Force 141 and conflict with the Konni Group.
Reception and Impact
Vladimir Makarov is widely recognized as the most memorable villain in the Call of Duty franchise. Vladimir Makarov is known for his merciless violence, and his global impact in the franchise's story, along with the controversy surrounding missions associated with him. His role in the series gave Call of Duty it's darker theme and tone.
